intro: Koanophyllon, commonly known as the mountain bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it adapts to cold and nutrient-poor soils. Koanophyllon species are known for their small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its botanical structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and a slender stem that supports the inflorescence.
